texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's so nice and cool in here. Is this heaven?
Sumomo languidly remarks, resting her chin on the palm of her hand.
Today is July 15th.
Halley's Comet will be the closest to Earth on July 28th.
We have less than two weeks.
The city is bustling today.
But we're here in the library to search for the location in my mom's sketch.
The list of possible sites is complete.
One by one, I ruled out the places where I knew the composition of the sketch couldn't be recreated.
It shouldn't take too long to narrow down the search now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So what now? We're here to find out where that sketch is supposed to be, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.
We pile up books with pictures and descriptions of national campsites, mountains, riverbanks, and forests on the table.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I made a copy of the list for you too.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay.
I hand the piece of paper to her.
It's a copy of the stuff I wrote in my notebook.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm gonna check from the top. Can you start from the bottom so we can meet in the middle?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We should be able to find photos of everywhere on the list in these books, so let's look for places that could match the sketch.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If it's a place my mom chose, maybe it's somewhere well known.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay! I'll give it a go.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm pooped!
Stunned, I raise my face from the books and turn to her.
I wasn't counting, but it probably hasn't been more than twenty seconds.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Aren't the letters super tiny?! Like, for real?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You don't have to read, just look at the pictures.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well, I guess this IS our secret project! I better put my back into it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Right...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay, no. I can't do this.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You know what they say about book smart versus street smart? I don't think I'm a book kinda gal.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm surprised you made it so far in university.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: When I started, it'd been ten years since I last picked up a mechanical pencil.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Man, I couldn't even believe they still sold them!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay, forget about the list. Go find some of my mom's articles. She might have written something about it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Your mommy wrote stuff?! Yes! I'll totes do that!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Holy camera magazines, Kanna!
While I work through my list, Sumomo goes looking for camera enthusiast magazines and returns with a stack of back issues.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Your mom's amazing! Her name comes up in a lot of magazines.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: They sold well enough, apparently.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Wheee, I can't wait to read her articles!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The letters are smaller than the ones before, though. You gonna be okay?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hello? They're Anna's articles! Of course I can read ‘em.
Despite my doubts, she actually sits down and quietly reads through the articles featuring interviews with my mom.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ooh, so she smoked too. Do all car enthusiasts have a thing for cigarettes? Our scrap hunter's the same.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't think it has much to do with cars.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You think?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You don't smoke?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I've tried it once or twice, but it's sooo gross, I always stopped after one puff. It makes me cough, the stink sticks to your clothes and hair, and it ruins your teeth.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sure does.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, it's her!
Sumomo cheerfully shows me the page of a magazine.
It's an advertisement for a compact digital camera that my mom's promoting.
It shows my mom in an urban area, crouching down and pointing her camera toward a cat.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She used to appear in commercials too, I heard.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really? This camera's so cute and small.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There's one in the garage.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I think it's a sample product. It's old, but pretty much unused.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I wanna use it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I wanna try taking photos too! Can I borrow the camera?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sure, I don't mind. No one's using it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Teach me how!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?
There's an intensity to her gaze that overpowers me a little.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Teach me how to use it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Me? Teach you?
Beaming, Sumomo nods vigorously.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This time you'll be my teacher!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't think there's much I can teach.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's just not true. You take super slamming photos. Teach me the tips and tricks, come on!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Well, sure.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right on! Let's go take photos together somewhere tomorrow, before we come back here!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Let's go to the terminal, then. It's close by, cooler than here, and there's not many people.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sounds good!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I can't wait!
With that, she goes back to reading articles.
I stare at her for a while as she flips through the pages, humming a happy tune to herself.
It's kind of curious, now that I think about it.
I'm hanging out casually with the person who was teaching my class not so long ago.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hm?
Noticing my gaze on her, she tilts her head a little in confusion.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Don't mind me.
I continue checking locations against my list while listening to her humming.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Anna was really cool, huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: She reads so natural in all of her interviews. Like she doesn't put on airs, you know?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Was there anything about the sketch in there?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nope, nothing at all. But she did talk a lot about you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really? What article is that?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: She wrote that her son is a lot like her.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Now I'm wondering if you'll be like that when you get older. You're gonna be swatting women away left and right.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wait, why?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Genuine men are a hit with the ladies. And you're really good looking too.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: If you lose that edginess you've got going on, you'll be the hottest boy in town.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I'm not trying to be edgy.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! That's what I'm talking about!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You said it's a compact camera, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, compact digital camera.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I can't wait to get my hands on it! I'm gonna take so many pictures!
We walk to the garage together.
The sun is already setting.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: By the way.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Where's your place? It's not this way, is it?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah! Crap! You're right!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You don't need to go back?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What's today's date?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?
Sumomo stops and puts a finger to her lips. You can practically see the wheels turning in her head.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's July 15th.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, crud.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I rent weekly...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: The contract ended today.
Sumomo stares into my eyes as the corner of her mouth quirk into a grin.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Eheh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You've gotta be kidding me.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Peach is moving in here too?! Why?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: The contract at the place I was staying only lasted for my training period. And the rent's crazy expensive.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Then what?! I'm gonna sleep on the floor now?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Come on! We can sleep together! I mean, it's a sofa bed, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Well, yeah but...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It's too crowded in here! Go book a hotel room or something!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whaat?! We're spending the whole summer together but you want to send me off to a hotel by myself?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: No way! We gotta live like a team if we wanna be one! I don't mind sleeping on the floor.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You think we'd let you sleep on the damn floor?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Where are you sleeping, Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Inside the car.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Can't we sleep in there together?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's cramped enough with just one person. Besides..
There are only about two weeks left until July 28th.
Can I keep all this hidden from Dad during that time?
I mean, I have two women sleeping in his garage...
How do I even begin to explain that?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, it'd be bad if we didn't tell your daddy about this.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Want me to try talking with him?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It'll only become a problem if he knows!
I turn to the camping equipment in the back of the garage.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We do have some sleeping bags lying around, so we can probably figure out some kind of sleeping arrangement.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: How are things with your daddy these days? Do you talk?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I told him I started going to class, but that's it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're going on that comet shoot without him knowing? We're probably gonna have to travel quite far to find that place.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't know yet, but probably.
Pursing my lips, I think for a moment.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Anyway.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It'd be too dangerous to do all this without saying anything, so I'll tell him...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...that some friends came to stay over at the garage, and that he should keep out.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I did it! I'm Candy's friend, you hear?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: More like we did it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Sigh*
The lights are on inside.
I take a deep breath.
I have good news for him.
I went to class until the closing ceremony, like he wanted.
Now I can focus my time on the camera without leaving anything undone.
I'll tell him about that first.
Then I'll tell him the other part while he's in a good mood.
I can do this. I can do it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay...
I find him reading a book on the sofa again.
It's a plain looking book. Work-related, probably.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Um...

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Mhm.
When I call out, he slowly lifts his face from the book.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Can we talk?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Sure.
He closes the book and looks up at me.
Still standing at the entrance to the living room, I take a quiet breath.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The closing ceremony was today.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The summer break starts tomorrow. I'll be in the garage, but I'm not just loafing around.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: How was it? It had been a while, right? Could you follow the lessons?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah. I'm fine on that.
He nods.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: This summer...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Halley's Comet is coming this summer. It's a chance that comes around only once every 76 years, and I...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I want to photograph it in Mom's place.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I want to take the photograph she wanted to take.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Mhm...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: This summer, if I...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If I get visible results, then I want to talk again seriously.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: About whether I'll go on to further study or start working right after graduating.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And I hope you'll listen to me.
He remains silent.
But then he gives me a little nod.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You're planning attend classes next semester, right?
I answer with my own nod.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: All right.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Thanks.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Mhm.
He picks up his book again and begins flipping through pages.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Also...

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Mhm.
This time he doesn't take his eyes off the pages.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Some, uh, friends are coming over and I was wondering if it'd be okay if they stayed in the garage.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Friends?
He looks up at me again.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: From college?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Yeah. Totally.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: And you're making them stay out there? Why not your room?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The garage is fine. The place has good ventilation, plus there's a fan and a fridge with cold drinks.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: They may be there for a while during summer break, so try to stay out of the garage in the meantime, if you can.
He blinks curiously at me a few times.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So, uh, that's it. See you.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Phew...
For now, I've said what I had to say.
I left out some details, but it's the truth for the most part.
It's actually the first time I've been able to tell my dad what I want.
Feeling way more accomplished now than I did during the closing ceremony, I go back to the garage.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, Kanna. How did it go?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Well enough.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Did he say we could stay?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, I told him you'd be here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Great!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Imagine taking in two hot babes to live in with you. This'll be the best summer break ever for you, eh, lucky Candy?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's more like you two invited yourselves here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm gonna go get my stuff. It's only a case about this big and a big bag about this size.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You mean the big black bag you always carry around?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That same one! Give me thirty mi—scratch that. I'll be back in an hour.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Gotcha.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Go get us something from the convenience store while you're at it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No alcohol.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why not?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Because you get drunk. And then you hurl.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Scrap Hunter Azuki does no such thing! What are you even talking about?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! I don't wanna get barfed on, so maybe next time.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You bitch!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hag!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Wha?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! I'll bring some snacks instead. Or something more filling? Cup noodles?
I nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Thanks, I'm kinda hungry.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sure thing. See you guys in a bit.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sure.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Who you calling a hag?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What a rude slag! Did you hear that, Candy?! Can you believe the gall of her?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: One question at a time...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Lock the doors, Candy! Lock the garage up right now! Make that bitch regret messing with me!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: As long as you keep getting mad over it, she'll keep calling you a hag.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Who are YOU calling a hag?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hellow!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hmph!
A little over an hour later, Sumomo comes back dragging two large bags with her.
While she was gone, I kept scouring the books I borrowed from the library.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's with the clothes?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Lounge clothes! I took a shower too! But I got all sweaty again on my way back.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Not enough to need another shower, though!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Where do you wanna sleep?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This sofa here. It's a sofa bed, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Both us girls can sleep together, right, Azuki?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Apparently I'm not young enough to be called a girl, remember?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hm? What're you sulking about? Is the menopause hitting you?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Candy! I'm not sleeping with Peach! You sleep with her!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: No!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Could you two stop it, for the love of...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Please, Azuki! We girls gotta stick together!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Lemme have half of the sofa, come on!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hngh... Don't you dare come out of your half, though. One finger on my side and you're going to the floor.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay! You got it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's my garage and my sofa, though.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Duly noted!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, and here you go.
I take the pink compact digital camera out of its dusty box and hand it over to her.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, the camera! And it's pink! It's the same as Anna had in the picture!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She didn't use it very much.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, really?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But it's not a bad camera. The battery's charging right now. You'll be able to use it by tomorrow.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thanks! It's sooo cute! I love it!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I can't wait for tomorrow! I'm gonna take a whole bunch of pictures of you!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You can photograph better things than my face in Terminal 1.
After looking the little pink camera all over with sparkles in her eyes, she carefully slips it into her bag.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What did I say about wearing clothes?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Aw come on! It's frickin' hot in here! And we got one more body giving off heat now!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Geez.
Why do I even bother?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Are you sure it's okay that I'm the only one sleeping in the car?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, like I said, us girls gotta stick together. Don't sweat it.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What, you wanna sleep together with us?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You wanna sleep between us? There's enough space.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Good night.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah!
I hurry into the car and shut the door behind me.
I can still hear the two of them talking loudly outside.
This is a special summer vacation for me.
And thankfully, the first day so far has been amazing.
Only ten more days until we get the starter for Hachimaru.
Until then, I have to narrow down those locations.
If possible, all the way down to just one, so we can set off there by the 26th.
One or two days may not mean much when it comes to how bright Halley's Comet will be.
But the day that the comet comes closest to Earth...
I feel like that'll be the day I feel the closest to a whole different world outside this planet.
The closest to Mom I'll ever be...
I need to make this chance count.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Aaaargh! I can't take it!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Azuki! Get off! Your legs are heavy! And you stink! When was the last time you took a bath?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: *Snore* Snore*

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: OMG, get UP!
Sumomo's loud voice rouses me from sleep.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna, are you awake?
I push myself up on my elbows.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's wrong?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sleeping next to Azuki is the worst! I can't get a wink like this. Can I sleep here?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh? Where?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: There.
She points to the camp bed I'm lying on.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No way!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I'm gonna go without sleep all night! My skin's gonna be ruined! I'll get bags under my eyes! No! I am NOT letting that happen!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uhhh...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'll be good... for now! What's the big deal?
Sumomo skips into the car and puts her hand on the ladder.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: W-W-Wait! Okay! I get it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Let me get down, geez.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: *Snore* Who you callin' hag... I've not hit no fuckin' menopause...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: She doesn't shut up, she tosses and turns all over, and she stinks!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She'd be upset to hear that, so you better not say it to her face.
Stealthily, so as not to wake Azuki, I take a sleeping bag from the camping equipment shelf.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah, you're lending me the sleeping bag? Thanks!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's for me. You sleep on the bed.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Badump!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're so kind!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I can't let a woman sleep on the floor, that's all.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thanks. I love you. Love you sooo much.
I'm sure she's just quick to get chummy with people like that.
Yeah, that must be it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Where are you sleeping?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Somewhere around here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whaat? But Azuki's too noisy. Let's sleep inside the car together. Her snoring and sleep talking are a double whammy, you know?
I look down at Azuki.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: ...Don't forget to subscribe... And smash that like button... *Snore*

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's she talking about?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Dunno. It's a mystery.
I never really noticed because I'm always sleeping in the car, but she really is damn loud.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Come on, let's sleep together inside, okay?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna, I'm sweepy!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay, okay.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, it feels like a super secret base.
I roll out a sleeping bag on the hard floor and lie down on it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thanks for letting me in. You sure you can sleep there?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll be fine.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Isn't the floor hard? If you can't sleep, I don't mind you joining me up here.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm fine, really.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And if I snore, be nice and pretend you didn't hear.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sure. Good night.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: We're going to go take photographs at the terminal tomorrow, remember?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, I know.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I can't wait! This might be the most fun I've ever had in my life!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thank you. I really mean it.
Yeah.
I think I'm also having a lot of fun spending time together with the two of them, even if it's a little overwhelming at times.
But there's no way I'm gonna tell her that.
Next morning...
Azuki finally manages to wake up just as Sumomo and I are dressed and about to leave.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? Why is Peach here?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, right. She's sleeping here now, yeah. You're up early.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Azuki, it was kinda crappy how you asked me to stay on my side and then punched and kicked me off the sofa. And don't get me started on your snoring!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You sleep talking, Peach? I've always slept like a baby. You sure you weren't dreaming about me kicking your ass or something?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Is she for real?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Candy, where are the bananas?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I bought breakfast yesterday at the convenience store. Feel free to eat.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, thanks for that.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: There's no bananas, though.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why not?! Scrap hunters need their daily banana intake!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I don't even.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We're going out, can you take care of the car on your own?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, yeah. I'll be done with the chassis today. After that we just need to wait for the starter.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Got it. Thanks.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This is nothing. A seasoned scrap hunter like me can do it with her eyes closed.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Go and have a good time, will you?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: How cool!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We'll be back by evening.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Gotcha.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, this is already bringing back memories. We walked through here together back in the old times, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah. It's summer break now, but there may still be some undergrads around. Let's hurry inside.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okie dokie!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This is such a nice place. It's so cool and comfortable, and there's no people around.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It really is pretty cool in here, huh?
Maybe it's the proximity to the water and greenery?
Now that I think about it, I don't tend to get sweaty while I'm here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Out you come.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You put in the battery, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yep! What should I photograph? What do you think?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Take pictures of whatever you like.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What do these buttons do?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Let me see.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So if you push this here to the right...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It does the big zoom!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But try to keep it on the left, okay?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I think you should stick with the auto mode at first.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Got it!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Any other tips?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mmh, I don't think you need to worry too much, but if you really want advice...
I set up the LCD screen on her camera to display a 3x3 grid.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If you're not sure how to photograph something, try to align the horizon with this line here, and position your subject where these two lines meet.
As a test, I line up the car in front of us at the intersection of the upper left grid and press the shutter.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: People say it's a composition that can help anchor the viewer.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oooh! I didn't know there were rules like that!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I wouldn't say it's a super strict like a rule or anything.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Try to think of it more as a guideline to follow when you're not sure what to do. Professionals often break away from those foundations depending on what they wanna do.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But it looks pretty simple. I'll give it a try.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Go for it.
For a while, we go our separate ways in the vast airport and photograph whatever takes our fancy.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna!
Sumomo calls out to me from a distance, and I look up from the viewfinder.
She comes running my way with the brightest smile I've ever seen.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Look at this!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?
She shows me the LCD screen of her camera, and I see myself from the back holding up my camera on the wide runway.
The horizon line is running across the bottom third of the grid, just like I showed her, and my figure overlaps the intersection of grid lines on the right side.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's nice. They look really good.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah! I suddenly don't feel like such a greenhorn!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're a genius! You're a great teacher!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: This is just basic stuff. Any book on composition can teach you the same in the first few pages.
I say, with a wry smile on my face.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But the left side on this picture is looking a little barren. See how I'm on the right side?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Uh-huh.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But I'm facing to the right, see? And the rest of the picture is on the other side. Doesn't it feel kind of oppressive?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hmm... Now that you mention it, I kind of see it?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: People tend to unconsciously follow the line of view of the subject in a photo. To make that visual transition smoother...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If I'm facing to the right, maybe you situate me at the left of the picture.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm not saying this is bad. This way you don't know what's beyond my line of sight, and it gives it a sense of mystery.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You think about all this while you're taking pictures?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Isn't that, like, super incredible?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No, uh, it's really nothing.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: No, it's incredible! It's so cool! Teach me more!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Sheesh, okay.
Struggling to stop the corners of my mouth from turning up, I tell her about what I know of photography.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Amazing! I've never been this far in!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Me neither.
As I explain the basics of composition to her, we head deeper into the airport site.
We enter the ruins of the terminal and go up the stairs, where we come out into an open space with a panoramic view of the whole area.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, Kanna! Snap some pics!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Take pictures of me. I mean, we're here alone and all.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, sure.
Sumomo smiles and strikes a modest pose.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, that's good.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Am I cute?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, crazy cute.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Do I look stylish?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Out of this world.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah!
I don't miss a single chance to photograph her bright smile.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yes! That smile is the cutest ever.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's the best. Give me more! More!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Who even are you right now?! Ahahah!
She keeps laughing.
It makes me smile as well.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Am I in the middle of the grid lines?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Doesn't matter. You're too pretty for that.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Badump!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yes, that's really good.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You're just the best. You little lady killer!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, sure, keep it coming.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, you talking back now?! You're a different person when you're behind that camera! No fair!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Did you get lots of pretty pictures?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, for sure.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Am I that good of a subject?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh? Y-Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I see. So you go back to normal when you put down the camera. How curious.
I notice the time stamp on the pictures as I check them over on my camera's display.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's about time for lunch. Let's go grab a bite then head to the library.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah! I had so much fun! Let's go take pictures together again soon!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah. That's why we're going to the library—to find our next location.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, yeah!
After sharing lunch, we go to the library.
Just like yesterday, I continue working my way down my list while Sumomo reads more magazine articles.
I get the feeling she's taking it a little more seriously today. Maybe getting some experience with a camera had an effect on her.
Strangely enough, it makes me happy that she's showing an interest in photography.
Blacking out possibilities from the list feels fulfilling in its own way.
At this rate, I'll easily be finished by the time the starter arrives.
Maybe we could even visit one of the nearby possible sites for a trial run while we're waiting.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah...
I mutter as I stare at the cover of the magazine Sumomo has in her hands.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's wrong?
Sumomo raises her face and gingerly holds up the cover for me to take a better look.
One of the headers on it reads "Anna Amei Memorial."
I give her a small nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There were many of those when it happened.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mind if I read it?
I nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Go ahead.
Sumomo flips through the pages, her gaze intent.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ava...lanche?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: An avalanche. It happened last January. Mom went to do a job in the Northern Alps and was caught up in an avalanche.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's a danger that's always there, no matter how experienced of a mountaineer you are. I read that you can minimize the risk, but it's never zero.
Sumomo nods along as I speak.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: ...I wish I could have met her.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, I'm sure she would have loved you girls. Maybe you'd have got along even better with her than I did.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Maybe!
I keep staring at magazine in her hands.
Almost twenty nationally renowned photographers sent memorial comments, and they were all printed in a special spread in the magazine.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mom knew her job wasn't always the safest, but she loved it, and she always did what she felt was right.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm sure she liked her life, even if it ended a little sooner than she hoped.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, I think the same.
I raise my face and look back at Sumomo.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: She looked really happy in that picture you keep in your living room. I think she was super happy too.
I give her a silent nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If she had one regret, it would be—
As I murmur, Sumomo smiles fearlessly and points her finger to the ceiling.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Halley's Comet!
I break into laughter at her.
Sumomo giggles too.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I remembered this time!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's right.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay! Operation Finding Anna is on!
She drops her gaze back to the magazine.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We're not really looking for her, though.
I mutter to myself, feeling a wry smile forming on my face.
As the sun sets, we leave the library.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You think Azuki's done working on the car by now?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Beats me. She did say that she'd be done with it today.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You think she would come help us at the library?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, fat chance.
I nod, and we laugh together as we walk home.
When we arrive at the garage, we find Azuki sitting on the sofa, eating bananas and flipping through a motorcycle magazine.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: The scrap hunter is demolishing a banana.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Nguh... The diet of a scrap hunter consists of bananas and porridge!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Porridge? What's that?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: My specialty, is what it is.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hmm.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What're you reading?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: A bike magazine. I'm looking to see if there're any second hand ones out there.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? Scrap hunters buy their bikes? You don't steal them?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Stealing stuff from people is a crime, you dummy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really now...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Scrap hunters negotiate a price both parties are happy with and strike a deal!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That sounds more like a used car hunter to me.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Stop that right now! What I do is hunt for usable parts among the scrap!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So you're a used car hunter that moonlights as a scrap hunter.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Stop trying to change my damn title! I can call myself whatever I want! And I'm a scrap hunter!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hunting for used cars is pretty much the same as looking for scrap.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Then how about scrappy used car hunter?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Leave me alone! God, you're annoying!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Is Hachimaru fixed up?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Do you really need to ask?! I'm looking for my next prey because this one's fixed up already! Need I remind you who squished my bike and made a pancake outta it?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That means...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: We're just waiting for the starter. It'll probably work. The cars from this era were all pretty simple.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You focus on deciding where we gotta go. Do you know where that sketch is supposed to be yet?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not yet. But I will by the time the starter gets here.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Good to hear.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So what're you gonna do from tomorrow, Azuki? Loaf around under the sun?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Do I look like a stray cat to you? I'm not just gonna lounge around doing nothing all day.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm pretty busy, I'll have you know! I have a lot of stuff going on.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You do? Like what?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: A lot of stuff! Important stuff!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You're totally doing nothing.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Aaagh, shut up!
We chow down on the cup noodles Sumumo bought yesterday and relax together.
I'm almost halfway through my list by now.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Ooh, there's a Clubman out there. Maybe something a little smaller wouldn't be so bad for my next bike.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, lookie here. It's a sexy Zetsu. It looks really slick. Maybe something bigger instead would be better.
Azuki peruses the used motorcycles in the magazine's ad section.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You really like bikes, huh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hm? I do like myself a good bike. They're like a trusty partner.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And not just bikes, I love all old vehicles. Our little Hachimaru has me head over heels. I want it. Gimme.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Knew you'd say that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So how long have you been into cars and stuff?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Ever since I was a little kid. Instead of dolls, I collected those miniature cars that were supposed to be for boys.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So you've liked them for a long time, huh? Why?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why, you ask? I just like what I like, man. I like them because... I like them?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, hey, Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mhm?
Sumomo directs a sweet smile at me, her hands clasped behind her back.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What is it?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Where's your bath?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Bath?
She nods.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yep.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...There isn't one.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Do you see any around here?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'd be fine washing myself inside the camper, or just taking a shower or something.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There's no running water in here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? Wait, what?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What are you doing about baths?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I just wash myself outside with the hose when the sun comes up.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: ...I don't think I can follow that example.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What about you, Azuki?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? I haven't taken a bath.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Excuse me?
Sumomo's mouth is stuck half open at that statement.
Her eyes kind of glaze over.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It's not like skipping out on bathing is gonna kill me or anything.
Sumomo takes a deep breath, her eyes wide open in sheer shock.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: DISGUSTING!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh?! What the hell? Who you calling disgusting?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're disgusting! I can't believe you! That's why you stink so bad!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That hurts! I know I'm cool, but I'm not made out of stone! You bully!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, you're not made out of stone, you're covered in freaking dirt! Have some respect for yourself!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Why the hell are you okay with this?! It's the middle of summer! We have no AC here! You okay in the head? Are you trying to kill yourself?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: No, but I'm gonna kill you!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna, make a bath! Azuki's gonna lose her humanity if she doesn't scrub the dirt off her butt!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I don't need your stupid concern! I was about to take a bath on my own! You idiot! Stupid! You huge bitch!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Look! See what I mean?! If she doesn't get a bath soon, she's gonna lose the sliver of dignity she has left as a woman!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'll! Make! It! Myself! I just didn't take a bath because I wanted to make it myself!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And I do have my dignity as a lady! I have it in spades!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Agh! You're filthy, get away from me! Take a bath first! Go on and make the damn thing!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'll remember this, you bitch!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why is this happening? What am I even doing?
I stare at the roaring flames in front of me.
I'm in charge of making sure the fire doesn't die out.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This feels so good! Thanks, Kanna.
My face feels hot because of the fire, not because of anything else. Definitely not.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This ain't half bad, I reckon.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right? It's just unthinkable for women to go without baths for so long. You better learn from this.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I was about to take a bath! Just today I was thinking about how I wanted to take one!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah!
When she laughs, a little drop of warm water flies off her and lands right onto my nose.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: If this was just a little bit bigger you could join us in here.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm fine...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah, you're so shy. What a cutie.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, poor Candy! The bitch's going down on you hard now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm not! I swear, you've gotta get your head out of the gutter!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Wh-What part of what I said was dirty?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Going down on men is super dirty.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I think you're the dirty one for taking it that way!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, you're totally the type to give bad head. I bet you get shy and don't put any effort in. That's a surefire way to get men to cheat on you.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Nuh-huh! I ain't ever been cheated on!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You just haven't realized it.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Stop talking shit!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's not! I'm talking from experience.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Thanks, I didn't need all that info!
I don't wanna hear any of this.
This girl talk is nothing like what I imagined.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You get cheated on because you look so easy. No guy would cheat on me. I'm a scrap hunter!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nah, girl. All men are like that.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The man I choose will be different!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You a virgin or something?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: No! Stop talking out of your ass! I'll be thirty this year!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Now that's funny! What kind of guys have you dated then?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm going back to the garage.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah, thanks! I'll watch the fire when it's your turn to take a bath.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll just wash myself with cold water later.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: He's getting shy! C-U-T-E!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hey, why do you think I'm gonna get cheated on?! Come on, spit it! Hey! Answer me! Bitch! Face this way!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hey! You damn bitch! Come back here! I'm not done with you!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Phew! I'm reborn! Thanks, Kanna. Now Azuki doesn't stink.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I don't! And I never did!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You wanna take a bath? I can watch the fire for you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm good. I'll wash tomorrow morning.
I'm comparing my list with the guidebooks of the Tohoku region I borrowed from the library.
Sumomo comes closer to me.
She smells kind of like peaches after her bath.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, so I was talking with Azuki just now.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You know about the, uh, starter thingie? Azuki won't have much to do until it gets here either, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Why don't we go camping somewhere nearby? We still have a lot of time until Halley's Comet day, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It'll be like a rehearsal for the big day! And Azuki doesn't stink anymore, so it'll be fine!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I never stank! God, will you ever drop it?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But we don't have a car?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Eh? But isn't this pretty much the sticks? Aren't there campsites around?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not that we can walk to, no.
But even as I say it, I have an idea.
One particular place I visited with Mom and Dad comes to mind.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We could take the bus, though.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really?! We can go? Let's do it!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why the heck are you so pumped about all this?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Because I was pumped for a summer treasure hunt, but we've done nothing but read in the library all day! The routine's getting old!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I know how you feel, but still...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Will you have enough time to scout out the place, Candy? You still gotta pin down where it might be, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Well, I should have plenty of time.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yes! Let's go!
I look at the camping equipment sitting in the corner of the garage.
Besides the sleeping bag I grabbed yesterday, none of the tools have seen much use as of late.
We used them every month back when Mom was alive.
All the gear looks kind of lonely now, sitting there gathering dust.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll look up campsites around here tomorrow.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll try to pick the place most likely to have the spot we're looking for, if that's okay.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, yeah! The place doesn't matter! I just wanna camp together! The three of us!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Heh, how bad can it be? So when are we leaving? Tomorrow?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We gotta ride the bus, so let's go the morning of the day after tomorrow. It's pretty late today, and we gotta spend tomorrow preparing.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Copy that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Shouldn't you be getting ready? I can do this on my own.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Don't you worry! I'm researching about camping!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm ready to tackle outdoor cooking! I like, totally know how to boil water!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: All right. Let's try to wrap things up here early.
She gives me an enthusiastic nod.
There are three campsites within twenty kilometers of home.
One of them is in the mountains, and is actually pretty family friendly. This is the only one of the campsites you can catch a bus to from in front of Nariyama Academy.
The other two are on open plains, so there's no chance the sketch is from either of them.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I think this place will do.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh? Where? Where?
I push the guide to the campsite over to her.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ooh! There's cows! They also sell ice cream! This looks good! I love it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's also kind of a candidate for the spot we're looking for. I often visited with my parents, and I kind of remember a cavern where you can look up at the sky.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Amazeballs! We could hit the jackpot before the car is even repaired!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I doubt we'll be that lucky.
But I suppose there's a chance.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So now we've decided on the spot, can we go back?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'd like to look up a few more places, if you don't mind.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sure thing, go for it! Ever since you taught me how to take pictures, it's even more fun to read camera magazines!
I've managed to narrow down the possible locations in the Tohoku and Kanto regions to just eight.
Now I just have to do the same with the western Nariyama area.
And finally, I'll use the car to visit each location and look for a place where I can take the picture that the sketch illustrates.
And if I can't find it after all this work, then I guess I can say I tried.
At the very least, I will have done everything I possibly could.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, hey, Kanna. Look at this.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It says this is Amei Anna's successor. Isn't this person about the same age as you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: My mom's successor?
The title of the article reads "The Next Amei Anna" in big, bold letters.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It says they go around on their motorcycle taking pictures of the sky.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kinda sounds like Azuki, huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Lemme see that.
I take the magazine from her.
Rising star of the industry. "Young nature photographer."

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Takuma?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: The guy who had a comment in that memorial article? Do you know him?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't.
The next Amei Anna?
How dare they use my mom's name to introduce this fucker?
I turn the page, hate and frustration beginning to tense my muscles.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: They take really beautiful pictures, huh?
It's a two-page spread of the starry sky.
...It really is a beautiful photo.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Looks like they have good equipment. Must be some rich kid.
I mutter under my breath while checking the lens details in the corner of the page.
F2.8 aperture, 16-35mm zoom.
Ultra wide-angle zoom lens, then.
I could take a picture like this if I had that kind of equipment, no problem.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna? Is something wrong?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really?
What the hell is that crap about them being the second coming of my mom?
Who uses the name of a dead person without permission like that?!
The magazine is probably just trying to hype this loser up.
God forbid the guy is going around calling himself my mom's successor.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna! Wait up!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What's wrong? Are you jealous another guy your age is doing well as a photographer?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No, I'm not!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're totes jealous.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm sorry! I didn't show you that to make you feel bad. I just thought maybe you knew them since they're using Anna's name and all.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Well, I don't know that guy, okay?!
It surprises me how loud my voice comes out.
And from the way her eyes widen, it looks like I scared Sumomo, too.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: S-Sorry, okay? Did I say something bad?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You both take beautiful pictures, as far as I can see. I don't really understand why you'd be mad.
No. That's not it.
Maybe it's the amount of pictures and different scenery I saw.
I also read the article.
It said that he couldn't make it in school, so he worked to get a motorcycle license and now travels all over Japan.
I know what it's like.
That's why I've been trying to do the same.
If you really wanna get serious about photography, then you don't have time for anything else.
The world won't wait for you.
That's what I wanted to do.
And I was right in the end.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Turn that frown upside down!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: We're all going camping together tomorrow, remember?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Then you can go and take pictures just as beautiful as those ones! It'll be fine!
Sighing, I pull myself together.
I'm being such a brat right now.
I shouldn't lash out at Sumomo just because I feel defeated.
I know that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sorry for yelling at you.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, don't worry.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It'll be fine. You enjoy taking pictures like nothing else, and that, uh, Takuma was it? He also likes photography, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're gonna become a photographer, so maybe you can make friends with him along the way.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mm?
Sumomo...
She treats me becoming a photographer like a fact set in stone.
She probably believes it more than I do.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sumomo.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You think I can become a photographer?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?
She tilts her head to the side in confusion.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You don't want to? You said you want to. Uh, what do you mean? Is there some reason you can't?
I smile despite myself.
I guess she's right.
Sumomo calls herself stupid all the time.
But she may be the best person I know at finding the most obvious, straightforward route that most others would overlook.
I can see that now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mm? Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Err, it's nothing, really.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Thanks.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? You're welcome?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You two have your luggage ready?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Wait, are you serious? We have to carry all this stuff?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This is, kind of, more than I expected, to be honest.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This whole thing was your idea, girl. No backing out now.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You should be grateful it's a campsite where we can rent tents and chairs. This gear is the bare minimum.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: For real? Camping is this hardcore?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I thought it was all about enjoying nature, eating tasty meat, and drinking hot coffee.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And all the time before and after that is spent setting up and then taking stuff down.
I nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And that's supposed to be fun?!

texts.name: Azuki&Kanna
texts.text: Sure is.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hah, if you say so. Oh well, I'll just see it as burning calories and push through.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm pretty sure your luggage is the lightest, though.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thanks, Kanna. I can feel your love. All right! I'm gonna do my best to get to the bus stop in one piece!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Man, Granny Peach can't carry her stuff, eh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, go off. It's too heavy.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Finally! My kingdom for a seat! I'm gonna die. Kanna, gimme a shoulder rub, please! Massage me till we're there.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hell no. It wasn't that bad, and you were carrying less than all of us.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I walked for fifteen whole minutes! I have more boobage weighing me down than you! Did you factor that in when you weighed the stuff?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: How could I even?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: They're heavy! It doesn't show because I'm small, but they're huge!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I do realize that...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ughhh, I'm beat. But it's so fun! But I'm so pooped! What I wouldn't give for a cold one right now.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It'll taste even better after we're all set up, so hang in there.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I. Will. Try.
Only ten minutes after boarding the bus, Sumomo makes a full recovery.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, Nariyama's pretty damn beautiful, huh? It's incredible. Nothing but mountains!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I thought you lived around here?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nowhere near. I go to a uni back in Tokyo. One bad enough to accept a birdbrain like me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, so why did you come here?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So I was, like, gonna do my teaching training in my alma mater, you know? Is that how you say it? But they kinda played hot potato with me before sending me to this academy out in the sticks.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: They sure made you someone else's problem, huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah, that they did.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So you're going back to Tokyo?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah. Guess I gotta start learning again when the new semester starts.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I've been toying with the idea of not forcing myself back into that mess, though.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Give it up already. You won't learn anything useful about real life just by doing what you're told in some stuffy college.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You're right about that.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: All the knowledge you need to live is out in the scrap field.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And where the heck is that?! Are you sure you don't mean the garbage dump? You smelly butt!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Shut up, will you?! The scrap field is sacred!
Doing what you're told, huh?
Can I really find some point in going back to the academy for the second semester?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Ah, there goes a Volkswagen Bus. Look at it go.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What bus?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That yellow, round-looking one.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ooh, it's so cute.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Good taste.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And what's that one over there? It looks pretty old.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That's a Volvo. They're the company that made the three-point safety belt and was nice enough to release the patent to the public. Cool, ain't it?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oooh! You really love cars, huh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah. I mean, they really are damn cool. Right, Candy?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh? Oh, yeah. I guess?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What's with that answer? Don't you like cars? Isn't that Hachimaru important to you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I guess it's because it's my mom's car. I'm sure I'll end up liking it even more if I learn to tinker with it myself, like you do.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Mm, gotcha.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: We're heeere! I'm so moved that the bus driver was nice enough to drive us all the way to the entrance!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really? You're not moved by the scenery?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's hard to appreciate the scenery when you're dead tired.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The slacker has a point.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Don't we need to talk to a receptionist or something?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah. It's not that expensive, but we do have to pay.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay! Azuki, you got the dosh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I have enough! Thank you very much!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yaaay! The tents are already set up! And there's chairs! Easy-peasy!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why the heck did you even wanna come camping?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I wanted us to spend time and talk together somewhere spacious and freeing!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hmm, but Candy's garage isn't that bad, is it?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well, no, but that's kind of our base of operations.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Don't you sometimes, like, want a change of scenery? To clear your head?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's only been two days since you moved into the garage, if I remember correctly.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: She just gets bored easily, that's what it is. You gotta rein that in a little, Peach.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm just genuine! More genuine than most pretty girls out there.
I prepare my mom's ultra wide-angle lens that I brought from home and hang the single-lens reflex camera around my neck.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay, I'm ready.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, what's that big thing?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: A lens to photograph the stars.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ooh! Bringing out the big guns!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm gonna show the sketch to the people in the lobby to see if they recognize the place.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I wanna start searching before it gets dark.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Let me come too! I brought my camera and all!
She excitedly pulls the pink camera out of her bag.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Can you stay with the tents, Azuki?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Sure. Taking it easy is more my thing anyway. You two be careful.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thanks! Let's go!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Look, there's a staff member over there. Let's ask them.
I nod, and we walk up to the member of staff by the reception.
The white-haired, amicable old man at the reception stares at the sketch for a while.

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: Mmh, what might this be? Conifers, maybe? I've half a mind to say it looks like a cave.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Do you know of any place like this around here?

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: There used to be conifer forests here once upon a time. Until that thing fifteen years ago, I reckon.
What thing fifteen years ago?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The wave eating?
The old man nods meekly.

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: The whole ecosystem in the area got thrown out of whack, and now it's all different. This sketch you got here must be rather old.
I nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But why? What messed up that, uh, ecosystem, was it?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I remember hearing that the pigeons don't really affect the environment.

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: But there's lots of them around Nariyama, you see. And they don't eat the insects that damage the plant life, like normal birds do. They just need water and sun to go about.

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: And the pests end up increasing and eating the trees and flowers, you see.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Makes sense.

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: Even ancient trees like the thousand-year-old wisteria are done for, and the forests haven't fared well at all. The only thing we can grow now is corn.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And corn is okay to plant?

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: It makes money, so the company here takes care of it well enough.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: In the ingredients we gave you earlier were some fresh-cut corn cobs from right on our doorstep. You better try 'em! Our Chiba corn is sweet and delicious, make no mistake!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So... There isn't a place that looks like this nearby anymore?

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: Hmm...
The old man stares intently at the sketch again.

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: There's a cave just through the corn field. I reckon it might look like this if you look up at the sky from there.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So the cave's still there?

texts.name: Reception Old Man
texts.text: It sure is.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We'll take a look. Thank you.
We walk through the cornfield in the direction the old man showed us.
This place isn't far from Nariyama city, yet the climate here is much nicer.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, this field sure is huge! We should bring Azuki here later.
Sumomo snaps a picture of the cornfield as it spreads out before us.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Can you walk on ahead?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I wanna take a picture of you from the back. Imagine it! The lone boy walking through the cornfield under the setting sun. Sounds kinda melancholy, no?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Let's do that later. I wanna see the cave.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Aww, but we're here now!
I look up at the sky.
It's a little cloudy today.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I just want to get this out of the way first.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I think it's that way. Come on.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oookay!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? Where's the cave? Is that it?
We come to a small hole that looks like an adult person would just barely be able to squeeze through.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Isn't the entrance a little small to call it a cave? It looks like we could get in, but would we be able to get out again?
I feel like I remember this place.
But...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I remember this being way bigger.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Maybe because you were smaller back then?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But I remember going in with my mom, so it'll probably be okay.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really now...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll go in first.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Be careful, okay?
The entrance is narrow at first before opening up into a spacious cave.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It looks okay. It's pretty big inside.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really? Can I fit in too?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, you should be fine. I can see light up ahead, too.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay, I'm coming in.
When she pops her head in, our eyes meet.
I reach out, take her hand, and help Sumomo through the narrow entrance.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm in!
She keeps her hand in mine.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's dark, so can we keep holding hands?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sure...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You wanna go towards the light?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.
Hand in hand, we slowly make our way forward.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Whoa...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa indeed!
Up ahead is a small patch of yellow flowers.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: They're so cute. What kind of flowers do you think they are?
Sumomo asks me as she leans over the flowers to take pictures.
I stand in the center of the flowerbed and look up.
There's a view of the sky from here, yeah.
I can see a sliver of the sunset sky peeking through the small, round hole above.
But...
It's not right.
The shape is completely different.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: This isn't the place.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: This isn't it. We probably can't see the comet from here.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's not a cave. Maybe it's a conifer forest like the old man said.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, I see.
The man also said that all the conifer forests around here were destroyed because of the pigeons.
This means that if the location still exists as it did back then, it's definitely not in Nariyama.
And if it was here, the place the sketch depicts is already long gone.
I heave a sad sigh.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I think this place is beautiful, too.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Let's take some pictures while we're here.
She's right. This is the only place where you can take a picture of the sky like this.
And...
I open the ultra wide-angle lens case I've been carrying.
I brought it all this way.
Might as well take some pictures.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: A special lens, to take good pictures of the night sky.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oooh.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're right. It'd be a shame not to make the most of it, now that we're here.
I align the camera with the hole overhead and click the shutter.
It's a little dark.
So I slow down the shutter speed.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What are you doing?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's a bit dark, so I'm slowing down the shutter speed. If it stays open for longer, it'll catch more light.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I see.
I release the shutter several times then check the screen.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Is it blurry?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If you slow down the shutter speed and let the camera shake even a little while it's still open, it comes out blurry.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sounds difficult. The flowers over here are pretty, too.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, but...
I point the camera to the sky again.
After a few more tries, I manage to get a picture without blur.
But even so...
I see nothing special in the picture. This isn't going to elicit any emotions from anyone.
I let out a deep sigh.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What's wrong? Is it no good?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, I guess not. It's not the right place, so it's kinda pointless.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But the red sky is so pretty.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The ones of the sunset I took in the terminal were far better.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You really don't look like you're having fun here at all. Does that have anything to do with it?
I look up from the camera display.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Me?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It looks more like you're taking an exam rather than enjoying yourself.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: We came all the way to such a beautiful place, so maybe just try to focus on having a good time taking pictures!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: If your memories of taking the pictures aren't fun, then what's the point of taking them at all?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So you know how the person that takes the picture can look at it and remember lots of stuff about it?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'll remember having fun, but do you think you'd remember this moment and see something you like looking back on?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Looking for Anna's treasure spot isn't some boring test.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm sure she'd be way happier if you had fun while searching for it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right?
I give her a quick, sullen nod.
We leave the cave shortly after.
This time, Sumomo is the one leading the way, holding my hand in hers.
It's already dark by the time we arrive back at the tent where Azuki's waiting for us.
We find her staring vacantly up at the starry sky, her cheeks already flushed from the alcohol.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Gah! Why are you drinking without me?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? Oh! Peach! Candy!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Why the heck?! We promised to toast and drink together! I've been looking forward to it all day!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Take a look at this sky, Peach. How many stars can you count?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She's counting stars?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: How original.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah. Compared to this mantle of stars, we're like little motes of dust.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I know what you're trying to say, but what's gotten into you?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I wanna drink too! Kanna, let's grill some tasty meat!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This is the damn best! Nature, meat, and beer!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm glad you like it.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah, nature's always best! Not like this is news to me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Please don't drink until you throw up this time. We only have the one tent.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And who's gonna barf?! I'll have you know that once something goes down my hatch, it doesn't come back out! That's how I roll!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Life's always a party when Azuki's around.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This ain't no party! I'm protesting this gross accusation!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Just don't overdo it. We've still gotta carry everything back tomorrow morning.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I know already! What are you?! My damn mom?!
After grilling and devouring the food we got with the welcome package, we put the fire out and crawl into the tent.
Azuki collapses on top of her sleeping bag without even bothering to get inside of it.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Aaah, camping's the best! I love you two! Time to sleep.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: She's such a problem drunk every single time.
Her words are harsh, but a wry smile plays across her face.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're gonna sleep like that, Azuki? How about changing clothes?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Who cares? We're camping! We can sleep, wake up, and go home in the same clothes!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Guess I can cut her some slack today. I better hit the hay too.
Sumomo turns back to me.
Her peachy scent fills the narrow tent.
I'm starting to think her shampoo is particularly strong.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I can't sleep next to Azuki, so you go in the middle, okay?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why me?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Become my shield! Protect the precious sleep of this novice camper!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uhhh...
Suddenly, the memories of Azuki barfing all over me come rushing back.
I look down at her.
She's hugging her sleeping bag, seemingly already deep asleep.
Maybe it'll be okay tonight?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Over here! Lie down right here.
Sumomo sits on the opposite side of the tent from Azuki and taps the middle ground between them, motioning me to come over.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This is your special seat.
I lay down on my back in between the two of them.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Today's been so much fun.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Right.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Did you enjoy today too?
I turn to Sumomo, so that we're facing each other.
Resting her head on her arm, she smiles at me.
I return her smile with one of my own and nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mhm mhm, it sure was fun. I'm so glad.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You can totally take good pictures, I'm sure of it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: No need to hurry. Everything will be just fine.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I need to hurry. Halley's Comet comes only once every 76 years.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But don't you think there's lots of other stuff you can photograph? Like, you know...
She stares at me with her huge, sparkling eyes.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Like you?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yep yep. Take more pictures of me! I love it when you photograph me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So don't worry. It'll all be fine...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: There's no need to rush...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Zzz...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sumomo?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Zzz... Zzz...
I get up, unzip Sumomo's sleeping bag, and gently cover her lower half with it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She doesn't seem so much older than me right now...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ouch!
Immediately after muttering that, Azuki's heel crashes down on my side.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Who're you calling old?! *Snore*

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Sigh*
She's an awful sleeper.
And her shirt's hiked up her stomach too.
I doubt it'll do much good, but I also cover her with the sleeping bag.
And as if on cue, she swipes it away with her feet.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's pretty hot, huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Zzz... Zzz...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Zzz... *Snore*
I hear Sumomo breathing softly on one side of me and Azuki snoring away on the other.
A sweet, peachy scent wafts from Sumomo.
And Azuki smells like a mix of the soap I always use and cigarettes.
The way their sleeping positions emphasize their cleavage is almost too much for me.
And then, I realize.
I won't be able to sleep a wink tonight.
There's absolutely no chance of it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Sigh*
I get up and unzip the entrance to the tent.
Sumomo's words are still rattling around inside my head.
She's right.
I wasn't having fun taking pictures today. Not at all.
But why not?
What Sumomo said is really making me think.
I've never really considered how I feel while I'm photographing something.
I worked under the assumption that a professional photographer is judged purely by what can be seen in the picture.
So I focused on composition, and how to capture the light, and so on.
I didn't give much thought to anything else.
What photos have I most enjoyed taking, up until now?
Searching for the answer, I remember the times I photographed Sumomo at the terminal.
I truly enjoyed taking those, from the bottom of my heart.
I felt like I was able to bring out and capture her charm. A charm no one else knows about.
Do I feel the same way about the stars?
Do I have the same conviction as my mom, that kept her waiting for Halley's Comet?
Do I love Hachimaru as strongly as Mom and Azuki?
I sneak into the tent and pick up my single-lens reflex camera.
The campsite is pretty dark at night.
I can't even see my feet without a flashlight.
It really brings home how bright the city is by contrast.
Even if people say the wave eating was our fault and we should reduce our dependence on technology, the difference between wilderness and civilization is still incredible.
I see the comet trailing through the sky.
I point my camera at it.
One, twice.
I press the shutter a few times, capturing the dazzling celestial body.
There's none of the excitement I felt with her.
Heaving a sigh, I walk back to the tent.
